posts.post_content:
It's a decent mana accel by itself: It enters untapped and provides half the mana spend to cast it.  
  
Put it in the right deck and it's also worth casting without kicker, where it can even do more than just help affinity.  
It turns a [Coretapper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coretapper) into a cúmulative mana accelerator, it can be tutored with [Trinket Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trinket Mage), and it can even become cheaper with [Etherium Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculptor)!  
Fun fact: Would you ever have imagined to reduce the cost of a ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol)-mana artifact? I guess not :D
posts.html:
It's a decent mana accel by itself: It enters untapped and provides half the mana spend to cast it.

Put it in the right deck and it's also worth casting without kicker, where it can even do more than just help affinity.
It turns a Coretapper into a cúmulative mana accelerator, it can be tutored with Trinket Mage, and it can even become cheaper with Etherium Sculptor!
Fun fact: Would you ever have imagined to reduce the cost of a -mana artifact? I guess not :D
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Mode (1/30/2010 7:23:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Using this in a white weenie deck seems kinda nice. Bring it in early, use it for a little bit of mana, then bounce it back to your hand when you bring a Kor Skyfisher into play.
  
   
Bring it back in with all the nice new land you have, make it generate more mana, and bring out someone like Iona a few turns earlier than usual.
  
   
Not an amazing card, but it's really not too shabby.
posts.html:
Using this in a white weenie deck seems kinda nice. Bring it in early, use it for a little bit of mana, then bounce it back to your hand when you bring a Kor Skyfisher into play.

Bring it back in with all the nice new land you have, make it generate more mana, and bring out someone like Iona a few turns earlier than usual.

Not an amazing card, but it's really not too shabby.

posts.post_content:
**@sethddickness:**  Yes, [Etherium Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculptor) reduces its cost by one, \*\*\*uming you pay the multikicker. One quick look at the rulings for [Etherium Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculptor) would tell you that:   
 This effect doesn't change the mana cost or converted mana cost of an artifact spell. Rather, it reduces the total cost of the spell, which is the amount you actually pay while casting it. The total cost takes into account additional or alternative costs.  
Kicker is an additional cost that is added to the total cost, which [Etherium Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculptor) reduces by 1.
posts.html:
@sethddickness: Yes, Etherium Sculptor reduces its cost by one, ***uming you pay the multikicker. One quick look at the rulings for Etherium Sculptor would tell you that:
This effect doesn't change the mana cost or converted mana cost of an artifact spell. Rather, it reduces the total cost of the spell, which is the amount you actually pay while casting it. The total cost takes into account additional or alternative costs.
Kicker is an additional cost that is added to the total cost, which Etherium Sculptor reduces by 1.

posts.post_content: I think its rather interesting that nobody mentions the most obvious use for this artifact besides for mana. You can bounce this to get out expensive artifacts with [master transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=master transmuter). Seems like the best use for it to me. But overall, def. a good card, that if you have the extra four mana to actually make it worth it, can really help. Although there are other alternatives for getting one or two mana extra that doesn't cost ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) or ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol).

posts.post_content:
I suppose you can't kick this one by providing one of the mana needed by tapping it instantly when it comes into play?   
  
Like on first turn: one land, tap for mana (halv the kick-cost) and Everflowing Chalice tapped for the last colorless mana to provide it's own kick. So you get Chalice into play on your first turn :)  
  
Logically the spell must resolve into an artifact before you can use it, but the stack works in mysterious ways
